page.title: 07A visitor to Tilshead School
page.content: On Friday our publican Mr Burwell came to visit us. He was once a sailor in the Royal Navy. He was a sailor for nine years and started when he was 18 years old. He trained on a{stone {frigate} called H.M.S. Raleigh. The first country he went to was Singapore where it was so hot that he wore sandels and shorts and nothing else. He went to Singapore called VC.10. His new ship was called H.M.S. Triumph. If anything went wrong with other ships H.M.S. Triumph put it right. He showed us some photos and some of his uniform. In those days sailors trousers had creases in them, so they could fold them up easily. In those days sailors drank rum. Once a princess came to visit his ship. Sometimes if they did not do as they were told, when they came into port they had to stay on the ship.
